New Records: India recorded their lowest-ever run total in a men's T20 Cricket World Cup match
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah led India's fightback, taking three wickets for only 14 runs
Pakistan collapsed, losing 7 wickets for 40 runs, to fall six runs short of the target
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted a close match due to geopolitical tensions and high demand for tickets
India captain Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of making early inroads and the never-say-die attitude in the team
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the support of Indian fans in the stands and credited the team's resilience for the win
He described Jasprit Bumrah as 'a genius with the ball' and said India want him 'to be in that mindset for the whole World Cup'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was watched by more than 400 million people worldwide
Tickets for the game were sold out, with secondary resale markets offering prices between $600 and $1200
The official attendance at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium was 34,028
